intro: Rubus demareanus, commonly known as the Demarean blackberry, is a species of bramble native to South America. It is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, dark berries that are typically harvested when fully ripe. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in woodland edges and disturbed soils. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
